ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer
Class PhysicsTouchHandler

java.lang.Object
  ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer.AbstractTouchHandler
      ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer.PhysicsTouchHandler

public class PhysicsTouchHandler
extends AbstractTouchHandler

The PhysicsTouchHandler is used to interact with application that have support for a physics engine built in. Because of this it needs to move the objects differently than if you just interact with a 3D scene. Instead of simply moving a shape to its destination point it creates a physical joint on the destination that attracts the shape, so that it gains physical momentum and keeps moving even if you remove your fingers.

Constructor Detail

PhysicsTouchHandler

public PhysicsTouchHandler(SceneManagerInterface sceneManager,
                           RendererInterface renderer,
                           GLViewer viewer,
                           AbstractTouchHandler.CameraMode cameraMode)
Instantiates a new physics touch handler. Sets the 2D mode of the plane to true so that this plane knows that it only needs to account for 2 dimensions.

Parameters:
sceneManager - the scene manager representing your 3D scene
renderer - the renderer that is used for drawing content on the screen.
viewer - the viewer that represents the view
cameraMode - the camera mode that is set
